# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

Here is a Julia function that cleans a column name:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Lowercasing the string
    col = lowercase(col)

    # Stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces
    col = strip(col)

    # Replacing all spaces and hyphens with an underscore
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_")
    
    return col
end
```

When you call the function `clean_column("My Column")`, it will return `"my_column"`.
